title: Comprehensive Development Plan for a YouTube-Like Video Streaming Platform
description: This plan outlines the end-to-end development of a scalable, robust, and feature-rich video streaming application, similar to YouTube. The project's primary objective is to deliver a Minimum Viable Product (MVP) that supports core functionalities including user authentication, video uploading, transcoding, streaming, and basic user interactions like commenting and liking. The plan is structured in five distinct phases: Analysis, Design, Development, Quality Assurance, and Deployment, ensuring a logical progression from concept to a production-ready application. It incorporates industry best practices for security, scalability, and maintainability.

tasks.title: Define MVP Requirements and User Stories
tasks.description: Collaborate with stakeholders to define the precise scope of the Minimum Viable Product. Create detailed user stories and acceptance criteria. - AC: Finalized feature list for MVP is signed off. - AC: User stories for all MVP features are documented in a project management tool. - AC: Key user flows (e.g., user registration, video upload, video playback) are mapped out.

tasks.title: Technology Stack Selection and Feasibility Analysis
tasks.description: Evaluate and select the optimal technology stack for backend, frontend, database, and video processing. Assess the technical feasibility of core features, especially video transcoding and CDN delivery. - AC: Final decision on programming languages, frameworks, and databases. - AC: A report detailing the chosen video processing and storage solution (e.g., AWS MediaConvert, S3, CloudFront). - AC: Feasibility report is approved by technical leads.

tasks.title: High-Level System Architecture Design
tasks.description: Create a high-level architectural diagram of the system. Decide on a microservices vs. monolith approach. Identify major components like User Service, Video Service, Notification Service, etc. - AC: A C4 model (Context, Containers) diagram is created. - AC: Communication patterns between services (e.g., REST, gRPC, message queues) are defined. - AC: The architecture plan is documented and reviewed.

tasks.title: Database Schema Design and Modeling
tasks.description: Design the relational or non-relational database schema. Define tables/collections for users, videos, channels, comments, likes, subscriptions, etc., including relationships and constraints. - AC: An Entity-Relationship Diagram (ERD) is created. - AC: Data types and constraints for all fields are specified. - AC: Schema is optimized for key query patterns.

tasks.title: API Specification with OpenAPI/Swagger
tasks.description: Define all API endpoints, request/response formats, and authentication requirements using the OpenAPI 3.0 specification. This serves as the contract between frontend and backend. - AC: All endpoints for user, video, and interaction services are documented. - AC: Example request/response payloads are provided. - AC: The specification is published to a shared repository.

tasks.title: UI/UX Wireframing and Prototyping
tasks.description: Create low-fidelity wireframes and high-fidelity mockups for all major user interfaces, including the home page, video player page, channel page, and upload flow. - AC: Wireframes for all MVP screens are complete. - AC: A clickable prototype is created in a tool like Figma. - AC: UI/UX designs are approved by stakeholders.

tasks.title: Video Processing and Delivery Pipeline Design
tasks.description: Design the end-to-end pipeline for video handling: from initial upload, to queuing, transcoding into multiple bitrates (e.g., 480p, 720p, 1080p), storing on a service like S3, and delivering via a CDN. - AC: A sequence diagram illustrating the entire flow is created. - AC: Transcoding profiles and output formats (HLS/DASH) are defined. - AC: Choice of CDN and configuration strategy is documented.

tasks.title: Setup Development Environment with Docker
tasks.description: Create a containerized local development environment using Docker and Docker Compose to ensure consistency across the team. - AC: A Dockerfile for each service is created. - AC: A docker-compose.yml file orchestrates all services (backend, db, etc.). - AC: Team members can run the entire stack with a single command.

tasks.title: Implement User Authentication & Authorization Service
tasks.description: Develop the backend service for user registration, login, and session management using JWTs. Implement password hashing and secure token handling. - AC: Endpoints for /register, /login, /logout are functional. - AC: Passwords are hashed using a strong algorithm (e.g., bcrypt). - AC: Protected endpoints correctly validate JWTs.

tasks.title: Database Schema Implementation and Migrations
tasks.description: Write and apply database migration scripts to create the tables, indexes, and relationships defined in the schema design. - AC: A migration tool (e.g., Flyway, Alembic) is integrated. - AC: All migrations run successfully against a clean database. - AC: A seeding script is created for essential lookup data.

tasks.title: Implement Video Upload API and Storage Logic
tasks.description: Develop the API endpoint to handle large video file uploads, potentially using multipart uploads. Integrate with a cloud storage solution like AWS S3. - AC: API accepts video file uploads and stores them in a temporary S3 bucket. - AC: Upload progress can be tracked. - AC: A message is published to a queue to trigger transcoding.

tasks.title: Develop Video Transcoding Worker Service
tasks.description: Create a background worker that consumes messages from the queue, downloads the raw video, transcodes it into multiple formats/resolutions using FFmpeg or a cloud service, and saves them to a permanent storage bucket. - AC: Worker successfully processes a video into HLS/DASH formats. - AC: Video metadata (duration, resolution) is updated in the database. - AC: The worker handles processing failures gracefully.

tasks.title: Implement Video Metadata API (CRUD)
tasks.description: Develop the CRUD API endpoints for managing video metadata (title, description, tags, thumbnails). - AC: Endpoints to create, read, update, and delete video details are available. - AC: API is protected, allowing only the video owner to modify or delete. - AC: API provides endpoints to list videos for the home feed.

tasks.title: Setup Frontend Project and Basic Layout
tasks.description: Initialize the frontend application using a modern framework (e.g., React, Vue). Implement the main application layout, including header, footer, and navigation. - AC: The frontend project is created with a standard folder structure. - AC: Routing is set up for main pages. - AC: A global state management solution (e.g., Redux, Pinia) is in place.

tasks.title: Develop Frontend Authentication Pages and Logic
tasks.description: Build the UI components for registration, login, and profile pages. Integrate with the User Authentication API to manage user state. - AC: Users can register and log in through the UI. - AC: The application state correctly reflects the user's authentication status. - AC: UI provides feedback for successful/failed authentication attempts.

tasks.title: Develop Video Player Component
tasks.description: Create a robust, responsive video player component that can play adaptive bitrate streaming formats (HLS/DASH). Include standard controls like play/pause, volume, fullscreen, and timeline scrubbing. - AC: The player component successfully streams video from the CDN. - AC: The player is responsive and works on different screen sizes. - AC: Player controls are fully functional.

tasks.title: Develop Video Detail Page
tasks.description: Create the page that displays a single video. This page will host the video player, show the video title, description, uploader information, and provide space for comments and related videos. - AC: Page fetches and displays video metadata from the API. - AC: The video player component is embedded and functional. - AC: Layout matches the approved UI/UX mockups.

tasks.title: Implement Commenting System API and UI
tasks.description: Develop the backend API for posting, fetching, and deleting comments. Implement the frontend UI to display comments and allow authenticated users to post new ones. - AC: API endpoints for CRUD operations on comments are working. - AC: UI on the video detail page displays comments in a threaded view. - AC: Users can post and delete their own comments.

tasks.title: Implement Like/Dislike System API and UI
tasks.description: Develop the API to handle liking and disliking a video. Implement the UI buttons on the video detail page and update the like/dislike counts dynamically. - AC: API endpoints to toggle like/dislike status are functional. - AC: UI buttons update state and counts without a page refresh. - AC: A user cannot both like and dislike the same video.

tasks.title: Implement Backend Unit and Integration Testing
tasks.description: Write unit tests for business logic in all backend services. Write integration tests to verify interactions between services and the database. - AC: Test coverage for critical services exceeds 80%. - AC: Integration tests for core user flows (register, login, upload) pass. - AC: Tests are integrated into the CI pipeline.

tasks.title: Implement Frontend Component and E2E Testing
tasks.description: Write unit tests for individual frontend components. Set up and write end-to-end (E2E) tests for critical user flows using a framework like Cypress or Playwright. - AC: Key components like the Video Player and forms have unit tests. - AC: E2E tests for login, video playback, and commenting flows pass. - AC: Tests run automatically in the CI pipeline.

tasks.title: Configure Cloud Infrastructure (IaC)
tasks.description: Provision all required cloud infrastructure (VPC, subnets, S3 buckets, managed database, Kubernetes/ECS cluster) using an Infrastructure as Code (IaC) tool like Terraform or CloudFormation. - AC: Terraform/CloudFormation scripts are written for all resources. - AC: Separate environments (staging, production) can be provisioned. - AC: Infrastructure state is managed remotely.

tasks.title: Implement CI/CD Pipeline
tasks.description: Set up a full CI/CD pipeline (e.g., using GitHub Actions, GitLab CI) that automates building, testing, containerizing, and deploying the application to staging and production environments. - AC: Pushes to 'main' branch trigger a build and test run. - AC: Merges to 'main' trigger a deployment to the staging environment. - AC: A manual approval step is required for production deployment.

tasks.title: Setup Monitoring, Logging, and Alerting
tasks.description: Integrate comprehensive monitoring and logging. Use tools like Prometheus/Grafana for metrics, an ELK stack or CloudWatch for logging, and configure alerts for critical failures (e.g., high error rates, server down). - AC: A centralized dashboard displays key application health metrics. - AC: Application logs are searchable and aggregated. - AC: Alerts are configured and sent to a dedicated channel (e.g., Slack, PagerDuty).

tasks.title: Perform Security and Penetration Testing
tasks.description: Conduct thorough security testing, including vulnerability scanning and manual penetration testing, to identify and mitigate common security risks like OWASP Top 10. - AC: Automated security scans (SAST/DAST) are integrated into the CI pipeline. - AC: A third-party or internal team performs a penetration test. - AC: All critical and high-severity vulnerabilities are remediated.

tasks.title: Perform Performance and Load Testing
tasks.description: Simulate high user traffic to test the application's performance, scalability, and stability under load. Identify and address bottlenecks in the API, database, and video delivery. - AC: A load testing script using a tool like k6 or JMeter is created. - AC: The system's response time and error rate under target load are measured. - AC: A performance report is generated and reviewed.

tasks.title: User Acceptance Testing (UAT)
tasks.description: Organize and conduct UAT with a group of stakeholders or beta testers to validate that the application meets business requirements and provides a good user experience. - AC: UAT test cases are prepared and shared with testers. - AC: Feedback is collected, triaged, and converted into actionable tasks. - AC: Stakeholders formally sign off on the UAT phase.

tasks.title: Production Deployment and Go-Live
tasks.description: Execute the production deployment plan. Perform final system checks and monitor the application closely after launch. - AC: A detailed deployment checklist is created. - AC: The application is successfully deployed to the production environment via the CI/CD pipeline. - AC: Post-launch monitoring confirms system stability and functionality.

tasks.title: Create Technical and User Documentation
tasks.description: Compile comprehensive documentation for the project. This includes API documentation, architecture diagrams, setup guides for developers, and user guides for end-users. - AC: API documentation is auto-generated and published. - AC: A developer onboarding guide is created. - AC: A basic user-facing help/FAQ section is written.

tasks.title: Production Deployment
tasks.description: Deploy all completed development work to production. 2 components ready for deployment.
